notes: One more with picking the color, two more connecting color to number

questions.text: A resistor's first three bands are Orange-Orange-Brown. What is the reported resistance of the resistor?
The first three bands on a resistor are Yellow-Green-Orange. What is the resistance of the resistor?
A resistor's first three color bands are Orange-Green-Green. What is the reported resistance of the resistor?
A resistor has a resistance of 500 Ohms (Green-Black-Yellow), and the fourth band is gold. According to the manufacturer, what range is possible for the resistance of the resistor?

answerChoices.text: The resistance should be exactly 500 Ohms.

questions.text: A resistor has a resistance of 8 kOhms (Gray-Black-Red), and the fourth band is silver. According to the manufacturer, what range is possible for the resistance of the resistor?

answerChoices.text: The resistance should be exactly 8 kOhms

questions.text: Each resistor has four color bands. How do you tell in which order to read the bands?

answerChoices.text: There is a little bit more space between the third and fourth bands.
There is a little bit more space before the first and second bands.
The fourth band is always silver or gold.
The resistance of the resistor is different depending on which way you place it in the circuit, and the bands are arranged accordingly.

questions.text: You want a resistor with a resistance of 15 Ohms. What color bands should you look for?

You have an analog ammeter whose scale goes up to 1 μA, and you want to find an excuse to use it, just for kicks. If connected to two D batteries (1.5 volts each), which of the following resistors would allow this ammeter to work correctly?
questions.note: Maybe should be moved to a more advanced quiz?
